Sure, there are many great thriller books that feature excellent pacing. Here are a few examples:
 
- "Gone Girl" by Gillian Flynn: The story takes on different perspectives of the central character Nick and his missing wife, Amy. The varied and uniquely structured pacing of the novel makes it a page-turner.
 
- "The Girl on the Train" by Paula Hawkins: A psychological thriller that follows the story of Rachel, an alcoholic, who becomes involved in a missing persons case. The pacing in the novel is fast and engrossing, with the tension building up with each reveal.
 
- "The Firm" by John Grisham: A legal thriller that follows a young lawyer who discovers that his new employer is involved in a conspiracy. The pacing of this novel is excellent, with scenes building in intensity and suspense leading to an explosive climax.
 
- "Red Dragon" by Thomas Harris: This is another Thomas Harris novel that features excellent pacing. It follows an FBI agent who seeks the help of a former FBI agent turned serial killer to catch another serial killer. The story's pacing increases steadily, leading readers on an emotional rollercoaster ride.
 
These are just a few examples, but there are many others that are well worth checking out.
